page.title: 04The Health Centre
page.content: The Health Centre is not just a place for people to be treated for illnesses but is used as a meeting place for organizations such as the Red Cross and St John's Ambulance. The Red Cross meet on Wednesday evenings and they do work which involves a tremendous amount of things not just first aid but natural disasters as well. The St John's Ambulance meet on Monday evenings and they do similar work to the Red Cross but cover a larger area in first aid. They attend fairs and other events to provide first aid if it is needed. There are four doctors and nurses and clerical staff who work together forming the Health Centre. It is open from 8.30 to 10 am and from 5 to 6.30 pm.
